text: Carl Dean Wilson (December 21, 1946 â€“ February 6, 1998) was an American musician and singer-songwriter. He co-founded the Beach Boys. He is best known as their lead guitarist, as the youngest brother of band-mates Brian and Dennis Wilson, and as the group's leader in the early 1970s. He died, aged 51, of lung cancer in 1998. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:Musicians from California Category:Singer-songwriters from California
title: Carl Wilson
